summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available primarily consist of staff payroll records and related information, including salary adjustments and termination details. His involvement is documented starting from January 1, 1977, as indicated by the payroll records. The documents do not provide specific details about his role within the HSCA or his direct involvement in the JFK assassination investigation, but they confirm his employment and provide a glimpse into his compensation and employment status.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in the provided documents. His payroll records offer insight into the administrative aspects of the HSCA's operations.
